Funny story.

I never really used to swear that often, but lets just say stress got the better of me at some point and I just started not caring like I used too I guess?

Plus I like to be funny so I just ended up using it to my advantage. always fun to see others freaking out after you say something so funny they cant stop laughing.

My family and friends say I'm like a fucking comedian.

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b9cfbd6368723c35c90000#post_53b9cfbd6368723c35c90000
I don't tend to swear that much, I just say things with a very deadpan style of words.

I remember one time I was talking with a bunch of friends about last words and I said.
"I will never forget my grandad's last words..."
At that point I went silent for a few seconds and they all looked rather serious. I then simply muttered "...'Oh fuck, It's a bus'" without changing my emotion. I think they stopped functioning because they were laughing so hard.

It's all in the delivery I find. If you swear rarely, it makes the moment when you do swear all the more punctual.

See also: "Precision F-Strike":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrecisionFStrike
topics.author: 515ddf93a4c72d8a1f000d57

I find myself creepy at times.

Laughing alone at literally nothing around. 

Talking to myself all the time.

Did I mention I literally laugh at nothing?

I could be trying to sleep and all of a sudden. "....hehehehe! Hahahaha!"

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b9d2df6368723cb2260200#post_53b9d2df6368723cb2260200
I had a similar story.

It was during Christmas at school (this was a few years ago) and in class in Maths we weren't doing much work. I was wearing a Santa hat at the time but that's not important.
For some reason the other pupils and the teacher were talking about depressing stuff in the news and as a result the class was a little...down. After one story the class was totally silent and I just said out loud in a sarcastic tone.

"Merry Christmas everyone"

I pretty much murdered the class in one line.
